originalQuestion: How long should you avoid contact with others if you have covid
redactedQuestion: How long should you avoid contact with others if you have covid

sentences: If you have COVID-19, you should isolate for at least 5 days after your symptoms started or after your positive test date if you have no symptoms.
After 5 days, you can end isolation if your symptoms have improved and you've been fever-free for at least 24 hours without medication.
However, you should continue to wear a mask in public settings for an additional 5 days.
Specific guidelines may vary based on your situation and local public health advice.

originalQuestion: when i sign in my cra indiviual account, they asking is amounts you reported on your most recent tax return but i haven't. How can i sign in, please help me. Thank Yo
redactedQuestion: when i sign in my cra indiviual account, they asking is amounts you reported on your most recent tax return but i haven't. How can i sign in, please help me. Thank Yo

paragraphs: If you haven't filed your taxes for the current or previous tax year, you won't be able to register for CRA's sign-in services using a CRA user ID and password or a Sign-In Partner. This is because the CRA uses information from your recent tax returns to verify your identity during the registration process.
Here are your options:
1. File your taxes: The best solution is to file your taxes for the current or previous tax year. Once your return is assessed, you'll be able to register for My Account.

2. If you live in British Columbia or Alberta: You may be able to register for My Account using your provincial digital ID (BC Services Card or Alberta.ca Account), as long as you have filed your taxes at least once in the past.
3. Contact the CRA: If you're unable to file your taxes immediately and need urgent access to your account, you may need to contact the CRA directly for assistance.
For information on how to file your taxes, you can visit the "Get ready to do your taxes" page on the CRA website.

originalQuestion: Where to see what my sin number is
redactedQuestion: Where to see what my sin number is

paragraphs: To find out what your Social Insurance Number (SIN) is, there are a few options:
1. Check your SIN card or confirmation letter if you have one. The SIN is a 9-digit number printed on these documents.
2. Look at your tax documents, such as your T4 slip or Notice of Assessment. Your SIN is usually listed on these forms.
3. If you can't find your SIN using the above methods, you can contact Service Canada to get your SIN or request a confirmation of your SIN.
For more information on SINs and how to obtain your number, you can visit the official Service Canada page about Social Insurance Numbers.

originalQuestion: une nouvelle demande de prestation maladie
redactedQuestion: une nouvelle demande de prestation maladie

paragraphs: Pour faire une nouvelle demande de prestations de maladie de l'assurance-emploi, voici les étapes à suivre :

1. Assurez-vous d'être admissible aux prestations de maladie. Vous devez avoir travaillé 600 heures assurables au cours de la dernière année et avoir une réduction d'au moins 40 % de votre revenu hebdomadaire.
2. Rassemblez les informations nécessaires, comme votre numéro d'assurance sociale, dates d'emploi et coordonnées bancaires.
3. Faites votre demande en ligne dès que vous arrêtez de travailler. N'attendez pas d'avoir votre relevé d'emploi.
4. Vous aurez besoin d'un certificat médical de votre médecin indiquant la durée prévue de votre maladie.
Pour commencer votre demande ou obtenir plus d'informations sur l'admissibilité et le processus, consultez la page sur les prestations de maladie de l'assurance-emploi.
aiResponse.citationHead: Vérifiez votre réponse et passez à l'étape suivante :

paragraphs: If you filed your 2023 tax return on April 30, 2024, and are expecting a refund, here's what you need to know:
For electronically filed returns, the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) typically issues refunds within 2 weeks. For paper-filed returns, it generally takes 8 weeks.
To check the status of your refund, you can use the CRA My Account service online. This will give you the most up-to-date information about your refund.
If you haven't received your refund within these timeframes, you may want to contact the CRA directly for more information.
